item.title: Tax return spreadsheet
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Bino Kochumol Varghese)
item.description: Download links This spreadsheet mirrors the HMRC “view my calculation” screen at the end of your tax return. Have not found any similar spreadsheet available to do this. It can be downloaded using the button here… Download Purpose Better understand the HMRC calculation especially the interaction of income, capital gains and dividends. Forecast how much income is in the high and low rate bands so that you can optimise tax Reduce the amount of income in the high rate band e.

item.title: How to use this Hugo theme ?
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Bino Kochumol Varghese)
item.description: After downloding the theme, uzip the file and go to the ’lightbi-hugo-master’ folder. Open the folder in you editor and run the hugo build command as below. hugo It will create a folder named ‘public’ and in the same you can find the website created by Hugo from the contents from ‘content’ folder and the theme. To check the website you can run the below command, hugo server In the command prompt you can see that your website has started to build and it will normally available at ‘http://localhost:1313/’.

item.title: Build a Hugo Blog
item.author: sample@gmail.com (Bino Kochumol Varghese)
item.description: Hugo? It’s a fast and static website generator written in the Go language. Websites built with Hugo can be hosted anywhere from GitHub Pages to Amazon S3 without any database or other language dependencies. First I started to use Hugo is for my Malayalam write up a blog wizbi tales (Malayalam is a language spoken in Kerala, India), After the initial learning curves, I loved it for simplicity and performance. And when I started this blog itself I didn’t think twice.
